## Ed25519.validatePublicKey() method

Validates a given public key to ensure that it corresponds to a valid point on the Ed25519 elliptic curve.

This method decodes the Edwards points from the key bytes and asserts their validity on the curve. If the points are not valid, the method returns false. If the points are valid, the method returns true.

Note: This method does not check whether the key corresponds to a known or authorized entity, or whether it has been compromised. It only checks the mathematical validity of the key.

**Signature:**

```typescript
static validatePublicKey(options: {
        key: Uint8Array;
    }): Promise<boolean>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  options | { key: Uint8Array; } | The options for the key validation. |

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;boolean&gt;

A Promise that resolves to a boolean indicating whether the key corresponds to a valid point on the Edwards curve.
